definitions.title: n.pr.m.
definitions.body: (cf. Ew:§ 45 d; Ēl is my judge; on a possible connexion with Zend dânu, wise, or wisdom cf. Che:OP 107; v. Palm. [[דנאל]] Vog:93)—

son of David 1Ch 3:1, [[דָּנִיֵּאל]], but dub, cf. Che:OP 106; LXX Damnihl, LXXL & Codd. Dalouia; ‖ 2Sa 3:3 [[כִּלְאָב]], LXX Dalouia; Klo:Sm prop. [[דּׂדִיׇּה]], & in Ch [[דּׂדִיאֵל]], but grounds precarious.
[[דָּנִיֵּאל]], priest of the line of Ithamar Ezr 8:2, Ne 10:7.
[[דָּנִאֵל]] a great sage Ez Eze 28:3; classed with Noah and Job as models of righteousness Ez Eze 14:14, Eze 14:20; perh. the same as
[[דָּנִיֵּאל]], one of the noble young men taken into captivity by Nebuchadrezzar acc. to Da 1:1–Da 1:6, the hero of the book of Daniel, Da 1:6 + 22 t. (also frequently in Aramaic section).
